content:
Oaxaca cheese is a great addition to a breakfast burrito. 

When it comes to adding Oaxaca cheese to your burrito, you can use it in a few different ways, depending on the texture you prefer. Here are some suggestions:

1. **Shred it**: Shredding the Oaxaca cheese will help it melt more evenly and distribute its creamy flavor throughout the burrito. You can use a box grater or a food processor to shred the cheese.
2. **Crumble it**: Crumbling the Oaxaca cheese will give you a more rustic texture and a slightly more distinct flavor. Simply break the cheese into small pieces and sprinkle them throughout the burrito.
3. **Slice it**: If you want to add a bit of texture and visual appeal to your burrito, you can slice the Oaxaca cheese into thin strips or medallions. This works well if you're using a larger burrito tortilla.

Regardless of which method you choose, be sure to add the Oaxaca cheese towards the end of the burrito-building process. This will help it melt slightly and bind the flavors together.

Here's a rough guide to follow:

1. Add the scrambled eggs, roasted sweet potatoes, and sautéed spinach and garlic to the tortilla.
2. Sprinkle the shredded or crumbled Oaxaca cheese over the top of the filling.
3. Add any additional toppings, such as salsa, sour cream, or cilantro.
4. Fold the bottom edge of the tortilla up over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll the burrito up tightly.

If you're slicing the Oaxaca cheese, you can add it on top of the filling before adding any additional toppings.

Remember, the key is to balance the flavors and textures. With the creamy Oaxaca cheese, sweet roasted sweet potatoes, and savory eggs and spinach, you'll have a delicious and satisfying breakfast burrito!
